title: Something smells fishy
subtitle: Fake 'fish farm' owes £8 million in tax
description: Landpoint Investments has come under fire for using its status as a "fish farm" to claim millions in tax subsidies. CEO Natalie Pemberton-Smith denies the error saying "we do own some fish farms and our developments, like the Schumpeter Shopping Mall, include fish vendors."

title: Nursing a grievance
subtitle: Nursing homes at breaking point
description: Nursing home staff are likely to strike at overcrowding and under staffing in Sheridan's two nursing homes. "When is Mayor Brump going to deliver on his election promise to build a new nursing home for Sheridan?", asks mayoral candidate Les Lessig

title: Council in the red
subtitle: £5 million black hole in local council budget
description: Mayor Brump is on the back foot today after £5 million black hole discovered in the latest budget. "Too many mysterious consultants and quiet handouts on Sheridan's books", says mayoral candidate Les Lessig

title: Schumpeter Shame!
subtitle: Schumpeter shopping mall staff forced to turn to food banks
description: Two journalists went undercover at Schumpeter to discover shocking employment conditions, with staff being paid less than Sheridan's living wage and forced to rely on food banks.

title: A&E shutdown
subtitle: "Take your emergencies elsewhere" says Mayor Brump
description: Mayor Brump has announced the closure of Sheridan General Hospital's A&E service, arguing citizens will be better served by the larger A&E facility in neighbouring Colville

title: Watch out Brump!
subtitle: Mayor Brump flashes Rolex
description: Sheridan Mayor Bob Brump faces hard questions after being photographed leaving local diner wearing £55000 Rolex. Its alleged the Rolex was a gift from CEO of Landpoint Investments Natalie Pemberton-Smith, who is behind the construction of new  Schumpeter Shopping Mall.

title: Breathless Brump
subtitle: The blame for pain falls mainly on the plane
description: Sheridan General Hospital reports record high admittence levels for asthma attacks this winter, with even town Mayor Bob Brump needing their services following an asthma attack at a picnic. Mayor Brump blames plane trees in Well's Woods for aggravating his asthma.

title: You're old, Sheridan
subtitle: Sheridan's aging population set to double in one decade
description: New research from Sheridan's premier thinktank Shinsights indicate Sheridan's population over 60 will nearly double within the next decade, as baby boomers refuse to die. 87 year old Jack Jerry says "this town isn't built for old people!"

title: Vote heist
subtitle: 5,000 votes go missing with stolen caravan
description: The latest Sheridan election is in turmoil after voting caravan is stolen with up to 5,000 ballots. 87 year old Jack Jerry, who has run the voting caravan for 18 years returned from afternoon siesta to find it gone.

title: Tiggywinkle tragedy
subtitle: Sheridan hedgehogs facing extinction
description: 87 year old pensioner Jack Jerry was left stranded in -2C weather outside bus stop after snowfall brings Sheridan bus service to a halt. With 2 inches of snow blanketing Sheridan streets and a further inch expected overnight, famed composer Nico Muhly, in town to rehearse his commissioned piece at this year's Hedgefest, fears frosty conditions may affect orchestra's preparations.

title: Floody hell!
subtitle: Local businesses left high and (not) dry
description: Sheridan High Street is under water again for the third time in eighteen months after a weekend of heavy rainfall. Dodds Cooperative was left to sandbag their own shop front after army reservists kept busy in larger local town Colville. Schumpeter Shopping Mall says "we're good here!"

title: Peter's Pond, you pong!
subtitle: Lessig raises stink over polluted water
description: Mayoral candidate Les Lessig calls out local property developer over stench from Well's Woods. Head of Sheridan Parks & Wildlife Lisa Truss enters negotiations with Landpoint Investments CEO Natalie Pemberton-Smith to clean up polluted water in Peter's Pond.
notes: <EB note I don't know much about fracking so please correct.

title: Snowpocalypse!
subtitle: 2 inch terror brings local bus network to its knees
description: 87 year old pensioner Jack Jerry was left stranded in -2C weather outside bus stop after snowfall brings Sheridan bus service to a halt. With 2 inches of snow blanketing Sheridan streets and a further inch expected overnight, Mayor Brump urges citizens to stop complaining and buy snow boots.

title: Take my breath away
subtitle: Air pollution leaves asthma sufferers wheezing
description: Mayoral candidate Les Lessig calls for cyclists-only zones in central Sheridan after air pollution levels exceed legal limits for 56th consecutive day. Sheridan General Hospital has linked increased admissions of asthma attacks with air pollution in Sheridan.

title: Green around the gills
subtitle: Skinny dipping locals left with algae infection
description: Bathing water quality in Sheridan's Peter's Pond is at a record low, with Head of Sheridan Parks & Wildlife Lisa Truss urging residents not to enter the water. These warnings went unheard by 87 year old Jack Jerry who after skinny dipping in Peter's Pond woke up with a mottled green skin condition, blamed on bacterial algae.

title: Ashes to dust
subtitle: Ash dieback devastates ancient woodlands
description: One of Sheridan's most popular natural attractions, Well's Woods, is facing a plague of ash dieback devastating its thousand year old trees. The precious woodlands, home to the only population of the Southern White-Crested Hedgehog and local bathing hotspot Peter's Pond, could be wiped out within the next decade.

title: Farmageddon!
subtitle: Local farmers sold wrong pesticide
description: Sheridan's Pikesley Farms is facing losses worth up to £20 million after incorrectly labelled organic pesticide wipes out crops. Pikesley Farms, the largest asparagus producer in the country, warns it could be "ruined" by pesticide supplier mistake with Schumpeter Shopping Mall business going to Colville-based rival Ponting Premium Growers.

title: Spike in production
subtitle: Hedgehog population blocks key business development
description: The discovery of a population of endangered Southern White Crested Hedgehogs in Well's Woods has halted Landpoint Investment plans for another shopping mall. Landpoint, who acquired 18% of Well's Wood's in a deal with Sheridan Council, are in talks with Sheridan Parks and Wildlife boss Lisa Truss about next steps.

title: Pikesley in a pickle
subtitle: Pikesley Farms forced to close flagship store on High Street
description: Largest asparagus producer in the country Pikesley Farms has been forced to close its flagship store and factory for asparagus products and gifts on Sheridan's high street. Pikesley blames cheap asparagus pickles and preserves from Colville growers for Pikesley's return to raw asparagus production. The end of the factory will see 143 jobs lost in Sheridan.

title: Wasted youth
subtitle: Sheridan youth unemployment reaches 53%
description: Latest demographic statistics show Sheridan has one of the highest rates of youth unemployment in the country, at 53%, as Pikesley Farm's asparagus products factory lays off staff. Local business Dodds Cooperative ties figures to rise in 'loitering youths' playing hacky sack outside High Street store and intimidating customers.

title: High street hijack
subtitle: Supermarket giant dwarfs independent retailers
description: The opening of mega-brand Schumpeter Shopping Mall tolls the death knell for local independent retailers. Family grocer Dodds Cooperative says business has dropped by 40% since Schumpeter rolled in.

title: The Age of Asparagus
subtitle: Bumper asparagus crops from nearby Colville price out local growers
description: Cheap Colville asparagus is in supermarkets around the country, to the chagrin of Sheridan's own Pikesley Farms, the largest producer of asparagus in the country. The bumper crops from Colville have driven down the price of local asparagus, leaving Pikesley out of pocket.

title: Poverty wages
subtitle: 12% of Sheridan town not paid a living wage
description: A labour scandal is threatening Sheridan after community hacktavists Sheridan Hacked! release report indicating 12% of Sheridan residents aren't paid a living wage. Mayoral candidate Les Lessig calls for new regulations on businesses to resolve the issue. Sheridan Hacked! plans "Jobs Jam" to solve wage problems with local employers.

title: Farm gated!
subtitle: Protesting farmers block access to town with 800 tractors
description: Farmers from Pikesley Farms, the country's largest asparagus growers, have barricaded access to Sheridan with tractors, in protest over Schumpeter Shopping Mall deals with Colville rivals Ponting Premium Growers. Local residents have been encouraged to stay at home until TractorGate has been resolved.

title: Signal on red
subtitle: Timetable changes threaten tourism
description: Reduced train service to Sheridan, coming in this month, threatens Sheridan's biggest tourist draw, annual classical music festival and hedgehog fundraiser Hedgefest. Speaking at the opening of the Brump Cable Car, which runs from Sheridan High Street to Shumpeter Shopping Mall, Mayor Brump urges visitors to expand their transport choices.

title: Holy moley!
subtitle: Super fast broadband stopped by super slow mole
description: The latest internet outage that affected Sheridan homes and businesses for two days has been put down to a mole chewing through a cable. Mayor Brump warns this will continue to happen until Sheridan's aging internet infrastructure can be upgraded.

title: Pension plunder
subtitle: Pyramid scheme pilfers precious pounds from pensioners
description: Sheridan pensioners have been left out of pocket after lucrative Shumpeter Tupperware fund turns out to be an empty pyramid scheme. 87 year old Jack Jerry says "I've lost my pension on plastic pots." Mayoral candidate Les Lessig claims pensioners could be looking at losses of up to 60% of their pension funds in the fall out from TuppaDisaster.

description: Government has introduced new legislation requiring that all geospatial data currently on the board be open

description: Sheridan public services are at breaking point and struggling to respond to emergencies. Draw three event cards immediately and adjust the Sheridan dashboard accordingly.
